question_sentence: NASA deliberately slammed a spacecraft into an asteroid this week to determine how to deflect space objects posing a threat to Earth. What was the name of the mission?
evidence: NASA’s DART mission – or Double Asteroid Redirection Test – was the agency’s first full-scale demonstration of deflection technology that can protect the planet.

question_sentence: Approximately how many customers in Florida were without power Thursday due to Hurricane Ian?
evidence: More than 2.5 million residences and businesses were without power in Florida on Thursday. “Ian is going to be a life-changing event. This is a very powerful, catastrophic storm that is going to do significant damage,” said Eric Silagy, CEO of Florida Power & Light.

question_sentence: Many Americans likely shell out more money to keep their homes warm this winter due to what?
evidence: Energy prices are on the rise in part because heat waves this summer forced utilities to draw down on their natural gas reserves, compounding the strain on inventory levels that were already below historical averages.

question_sentence: Giorgia Meloni claimed victory this week to become which country’s new prime minister?
evidence: A 45-year-old mother from Rome, Giorgia Meloni will become Italy’s most far-right prime minister since the fascist era of Benito Mussolini. Meloni is deeply conservative, openly anti-LGBTQ, and has also called abortion a “tragedy,” raising fears for the future of women’s rights in the country.

question_sentence: Which pop star will perform at next year’s Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show?
evidence: Rihanna will headline the 2023 Super Bowl Halftime Show, the NFL announced. The 57th Super Bowl will take place on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona.

question_sentence: Which airline was named the world’s best for 2022?
evidence: This year’s winner, Qatar Airways, has received the top prize seven times since the Skytrax World Airline Awards were introduced in 1999. Skytrax, a UK-based airline and airport review and ranking site, conducted more than 14 million customer surveys in more than 100 countries to find out the world’s current best airline.

question_sentence: Which currency recently plummeted to a record low against the US dollar?
evidence: The British pound plunged nearly 5% on Monday to just above $1.03 on growing fears about the stability of the UK government’s finances.

question_sentence: Which Major League Baseball team was invited to a celebration at the White House this week?
evidence: The Atlanta Braves were invited to the White House on Monday to celebrate their 2021 World Series win. Check out photos from the event here and see the jersey they gifted to President Biden.

question_sentence: Which new character did M&M’s add to the brand’s lineup this week?
evidence: The brand said the addition of the purple character is to “reflect the world that we’re living in.” The purple peanut M&M is the first new character in 10 years, according to the brand.

question_sentence: NBA star LeBron James has agreed to buy a team in which major sports league?
evidence: NBA superstar LeBron James is expanding his sports portfolio to include the US’ new favorite pastime: Pickleball.

question_sentence: More than 1,000 students walked out of Virginia middle and high schools this week in protest of what?
American Hans Niemann was accused of cheating in competition by five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen. What sport do they play?
Out of 200 purebred dog breeds recognized by the American Kennel Club, which was the most searched in the U.S., according to Google data?
Costco’s CFO said the store’s snack bar will keep the current price of its famous hot dog and soda combo maybe “forever.” How much is it?
Referendums dismissed by the West as "shams" in Russian-held regions in Ukraine were held in this week. Which is not one of those areas?
The headliner for the Super Bowl halftime show in February was announced this week. Who will be performing?
Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill into law that gives Californians a new end-of-life burial option. What is it?
As part of a groundbreaking planetary defense test, NASA crashed a spacecraft into what?
Which restaurant chain has an index that's been used to predict how severely natural disasters – like Hurricane Ian – will affect an area?
With his 61st home run, which New York Yankees star tied Roger Maris' American League record for most homers in a season this week?
What is the name of the category 4 hurricane that has left a trail of destruction in Florida?
evidence: Hurricane Ian has brought damaging winds and storm surges to the Florida coast, leading to severe flooding. More than two million residents have been left without electricity.

question_sentence: In which country has Edward Snowden been granted citizenship, nine years after fleeing the US where he is wanted on spying charges?
evidence: The whistleblower has lived in Moscow for nine years since fleeing the US, and was given permanent residency in 2020. He was one of 72 foreigners granted a passport this week in a decree signed by President Vladimir Putin.

question_sentence: What percentage of Britons believe they could win a fight against a chimpanzee, according to a YouGov poll?
evidence: Researchers asked people in Britain and America whether they felt they could overcome 15 animals, wild and domestic. Among Americans 17% believe they would win in a fight against a chimpanzee.

question_sentence: Which nation has become the latest to legalise same-sex marriage after a referendum?
evidence: Cubans voted in favour of a family code that increases protections for minorities on the island. Same-sex couples also now have the right to adopt children.

question_sentence: How many miles from Earth was the asteroid that Nasa successfully crashed a spacecraft into this week as part of a planetary defence test?
evidence: The ten-month $325m mission, known as  Dart (Double Asteroid Redirection Test), was the first attempt to shift the position of an asteroid or any other natural object in space.

question_sentence: Roger Federer retired from top-flight tennis this week after an illustrious career in which he won how many Grand Slam singles titles?
evidence: The Swiss great, aged 41, announced that last weekend’s Laver Cup in London would mark his final competitive appearance.

question_sentence: Who plays Boris Johnson in This England, a new six-part TV series﻿ chronicling the former prime minister’s premiership?
evidence: Kenneth Branagh dons a wig and prosthetics to portray the former PM in Michael Winterbottom’s Sky Atlantic series.

question_sentence: A petition has been started to rid Prince William and his wife Catherine of which of their titles?
evidence: A petition calling for the title of Prince of Wales to be scrapped “out of respect for Wales” has been gathering pace, gaining more than 35,000 signatures over the past three weeks.

question_sentence: How many sheep did a British woman shear in eight hours to set a new world record?
evidence: Marie Prebble, 34, whose family has farmed in Kent for centuries, sheared one strong wool lamb every 90 seconds, equivalent to more than 46 an hour, to claim the first record for a woman.

question_sentence: In which UK city is this year’s Conservative Party conference about to take place?
evidence: The Tory conference comes amid discontent among the party’s backbench MPs due to the market chaos that has emerged in the wake of Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng’s mini-budget last week.
